definitions.definition: To damage or vandalize something, especially a surface, in a visible or conspicuous manner.
definitions.example: After the painting was defaced a decade ago, it went viral and has been a tourist attraction ever since.

definitions.definition: To void or devalue; to nullify or degrade the face value of.
definitions.example: He defaced the I.O.U. notes by scrawling "void" over them.

definitions.definition: (flags) To alter a coat of arms or a flag by adding an element to it.
definitions.example: You get the Finnish state flag by defacing the national flag with the state coat of arms placed in the middle of the cross.
